title: Heico, PDD Holdings And 3 Stocks To Watch Heading Into Monday - Bridgford Foods (NASDAQ:BRID), Heico (NYSE:HEI)
description: US stock futures mixed, PDD, FiscalNote, & Semtech earnings expected. Bridgford & Heico to report after closing.
content:
With U.S. stock futures trading mixed this morning on Monday, some of the stocks that may grab investor focus today are as follows:
• Wall Street expects PDD Holdings Inc. to report quarterly earnings at $1.69 per share on revenue of $14.35 billion before the opening bell, according to data from Benzinga Pro. PDD shares rose 0.6% to $127.83 in after-hours trading.
• FiscalNote Holdings Inc. disclosed a 1-for-12 reverse stock split of common stock. FiscalNote shares gained 1.1% to $0.52 in the after-hours trading session.
• Analysts are expecting Semtech Corp. to post quarterly earnings at 40 cents per share on revenue of $256.09 million. The company will release earnings after the markets close. Semtech shares gained 0.2% to $51.20 in after-hours trading.

Check out our premarket coverage here
• Bridgford Foods Corp. posted a loss of 18 cents per share for the third quarter, versus a year-ago loss of 20 cents per share. Its sales rose to $51.954 million from $49.263 million. Bridgford Foods shares closed at $7.53 on Friday.
• Analysts expect Heico Corp. to post quarterly earnings at $1.14 per share on revenue of $1.12 billion after the closing bell. Heico shares rose 0.6% to close at $309.59 on Friday.
• Top 2 Tech Stocks That May Collapse In August
summary: U.S. stock futures trading are mixed this morning, with several key stocks expected to be on the rise. Analysts predict that PDD Holdings Inc. will report quarterly earnings of $1.69 per share on revenue of $14.35 billion before the opening bell, and PDD shares rose 0.6% to $127.83 in after-hours trading. Meanwhile, FiscalNote Holdings Inc., which also disclosed a 1-for-12 reverse stock split of common stock, saw its shares rise 1.1% in the after-hour trading session.
shortSummary: Despite mixed earnings reports, key stocks like Bridgford Foods, Heico, PDD Holdings, and FiscalNote are expected to rise as investors await the results.

scraped_sources.text:
As of Aug. 22, 2025, two stocks in the information technology sector could be flashing a real warning to investors who value momentum as a key criteria in their trading decisions.
The RSI is a momentum indicator, which compares a stock’s strength on days when prices go up to its strength on days when prices go down. When compared to a stock’s price action, it can give traders a better sense of how a stock may perform in the short term. An asset is typically considered overbought when the RSI is above 70, according to Benzinga Pro.
Here's the latest list of major overbought players in this sector.
Gilat Satellite Networks Ltd GILT
- On Aug. 20, Gilat announced over $60 million in commercial orders for its Stellar Blu Sidewinder ESA terminals. “The Stellar Blu Sidewinder ESA is redefining airborne connectivity with the performance and flexibility today’s aviation customers demand,” said Tracy Trent, President, Gilat Stellar Blu. “This momentum is opening significant opportunities to expand into high-value markets like VVIP and special mission aircraft, delivering advanced solutions that meet the most demanding connectivity requirements.” The company's stock jumped around 20% over the past month and has a 52-week high of $9.54.
- RSI Value: 70.2
- GILT Price Action: Shares of Gilat Satellite Networks rose 6.9% to close at $9.51 on Thursday.
- Edge Stock Ratings: 91.03 Momentum score with Value at 59.72.
Corning Inc GLW
- On Aug. 6, Corning announced an expanded partnership with Apple Inc AAPL to make precision glass for Apple products. Apple announced a new $100 billion commitment to increase investments in the U.S., bringing the company's total commitment up to $600 billion. The company's stock gained around 20% over the past month and has a 52-week high of $66.50.
- RSI Value: 70.9
- GLW Price Action: Shares of Corning gained 0.5% to close at $64.89 on Thursday.
Curious about other BZ Edge Rankings? Click here to discover how similar stocks measure up.

How to Trade Premarket
So, how do you trade during premarket hours? You start by:
- Ensure that the trade you wish to make is allowed by your broker
- Determine how many shares you want to buy or sell — using your budget as a guide
- Submit the order
- Remain patient
When you’re ready to trade premarket, you need to know what you’re doing. During premarket hours, you may be allowed to complete trades, purchases, or sales if your broker allows it. Some brokers might allow you limited access to the markets while others may only have access to a few networks.
As a result, order speeds may be slower than during normal market hours. Check the guidelines and disclosures for your brokerage account before assuming your broker allows for premarket trading.
Yes, you may be responding to current news items, but so are many other traders. Understand your limitations before jumping into a trade that may or may not be timely or make sense.
Frequently Asked Questions About Premarket Trading
When does premarket open?
Premarket occurs 7 am EST to 9:30 am EST Monday - Friday. After-hours trading occurs from 4 pm EST to 8 pm EST during the workweek. In the Central Time Zone, premarket begins at 6 am and ends at 8:30 am. In the Mountain time zone, premarket lasts from 5:00 am until 7:30 am, and in the Pacific time zone, premarket begins at 4 am and ends at 6:30 am.
Can you buy options premarket?
Generally, no, you cannot buy options premarket. Options usually trade from 9:30 am to 4 pm EST.
Can you set a stop loss in premarket?
No, you cannot set a stop loss in the premarket. Stop orders generally only trigger during market sessions from 9:30 am to 4 pm EST.

argos_summary: The article highlights key pre‑market activity, noting earnings expectations for PDD Holdings, FiscalNote, Semtech, Bridgford Foods, and Heico, with PDD projected to earn $1.69 per share on $14.35 billion revenue. It also flags two over‑bought tech stocks—Gilat Satellite Networks (RSI 70.2) and Corning (RSI 70.9)—that may be at risk of a pullback. Additionally, the piece provides a quick guide to pre‑market trading rules and a snapshot of the broader market indices and upcoming economic data.
